critique: This executive order aims to increase the participation of Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) in federally sponsored programs. It directs the Secretary of Education to oversee the development of a federal program to achieve this goal, identify and eliminate barriers to participation, and involve private sector institutions. It also requires each Executive Department and agency to establish annual plans to increase the ability of HBCUs to participate in these programs. The order emphasizes equal opportunity and seeks to address past discriminatory treatment. It promotes diversity and inclusion by focusing on HBCUs. There is no indication of immigration restrictions, expansion of executive power beyond directing agencies, or a shift in federalism. It does not directly address national security or economic regulation. Therefore, the scores reflect a liberal ideological tilt and an emphasis on social inclusion.
